events.1613: Emperor Jahangir in a proclamation permitted East India Company to establish factories in Surat. And the first British factory was established under Thomas Aldworth.
events.1858: Shridhar Pathak, famous Hindi poet, was born.
events.1859: Lord Curzon, Governor General and Viceroy, was born.
events.1921: Vasudevacharya Kerur, famous Kannad novelist, drama writer and journalist, passed away.
events.1955: Production of Newsprint paper factory started for the first time in India.
events.1958: Two lakh Indians in East Pakistan were rounded up and lodged in concentration camps.
events.1960: Pakistan and India agree on disputed boundary between Punjab and W. at Pakistan.
events.1966: Lal Bahadur Shastri was posthumously awarded the "Bharat Ratna".
events.1973: Rahul Dravid, cricket batsman, was born in Indore.
events.1975: Oil struck in third Bombay High rig.
events.1986: Union Government declares Ladakh a Scheduled Tribe area under a constitutional amendment order by the President, applying article 342 for the first time to J&K.
events.1990: R. Shekhar became the director of Central Bureau of Investigation (till 14/12/90).
events.1991: Ravi Naik of Maharashtra Gomanthak party sworn in as the CM of Goa.
events.1993: Communal violence in Bombay and Ahmedabad spreads; By-elections postponed.
events.1994: Shankarrao Savekar, veteran cameraman of  film industry, passed away.
events.1995: Kumari Anandan replaces Vazhapadi K. Ramamurthy as TNCC (I) chief.
events.1996: Canadian PM Jean Chretien visits New Delhi.
events.1998: C. V. Gadkari, great Indian Test all-rounder 1953-55, passed away.
events.1999: Four DRDO scientists and four pilots aboard an Avro plane on a research test flight are killed as the plane crashes after take-off from the Arakkonam INS Rajali Naval air base in Tamil Nadu.
events.2000: Mrs. Anju, wife of Shoaib Ilyasi of 'India's Most Wanted' famed serial, dies under mysterious circumstances.
